noun.description: A member of a Christian sect, founded in the US in 1848, that claims to return to the beliefs and practices of the earliest disciples and holds that Christ will return in power to set up a worldwide theocracy beginning at Jerusalem.

adjective.description: Of or adhering to the Christadelphians and their beliefs.

origin: From late Greek Khristadelphos in brotherhood with Christ (from Greek Khristos Christ + adelphos brother) + -ian.
